nl_problem:
# Task: activity_selection
# Interface:
Class: Solution
Method: maxActivities(self, arg1)

You are given n activities with their start and finish times. Select the maximum number of activities that can be performed by a single person, assuming that a person can only work on a single activity at a time.
Input is a list of pairs `(start, finish)`.

Constraints:
- 1 <= n <= 10^5
- 0 <= start < finish <= 10^9
lisp_spec:
(task
  (name "maxActivities")
  (signature ( (activities list) ) int)
  (constraints
    (constraint "The number of activities, n, is between 1 and 10^5.")
    (constraint "Each activity's start time is non-negative and less than its finish time.")
    (constraint "Start times are less than or equal to finish times for all activities.")
  )
  (goal
    (description "Select the maximum number of non-overlapping activities from a list, assuming one activity at a time.")
    (rule "Sort the activities by their end times in ascending order.")
    (return "The length of the longest sequence of non-overlapping activities after sorting."))
)
